{{Wireless embedded system |brand=NEC |model=Aterm MR03LN |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=01/20/2014 |manuf_country=Japan |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=mobile hotspot |fcc_id=2AA5WPAMR03LN |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=MDM9225;MDM9225, 0VV, 51664, AK555.G8, H531201; |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=512 MiB |fla1_brand=Toshiba |fla1_model=TC58NYG2S0FBAI4 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=256 MiB |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT6TL64M32BI-G1 |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand= |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports= |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.179.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=1234 |oui= |oui_eth= }} "AG1-001334-002" and "(e) QUIN-M [2]" is on the unit's main board in the FCC photos. :"QUIN-S" and "AG1-001335-002" looks to be on the microSIM + Flash + ??? board. A sticker w/ "QUIN-S ES2 No.81" is stuck on the other side of the board.
The battery shown in the FCC photos has a capacity of 2300 mAh @ 3.8V (8.8 Wh).
Default settings are per the FCC manual. The default SSID may be '''AtermMR03LN''' or something containing that string..
